content.raw:
It was very tough to find out why the newRGBPointCloud event wasn't firing from a rendering::DepthCamera.  The documentation for the ConnectNewRGBPointCloud method should state that this event will only fire if the <sensor>/<camera>/<depth_camera>/<output> element is set to "points" in the depth camera's SDF file.  The documentation is lacking on SDFormat.org as well... the <depth_camera>/<output> description should say what the options for <output> are and how they will effect the camera's output.

Right now the only way to find all of this information out on your own is to look at gazebo's source code and try to figure out how the event is called.

EDIT:  Based on [this bug](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/1865/rendering-depthcamera-does-not-output), it may be the case that the <depth_camera>/<output> SDF element description was intentionally left blank in the SDFormat.org documentation. Setting the <output> to "points" causes a known issue to arise in the rendering::DepthCamera code, which messes up the RGB colors of the point cloud in the gazebo_ros_depth_camera plugin of gazebo_ros_packages.
